column4: HI there, I have changed my /home directory onto another drive. NOw i am getting gnome.conf errors. Any ideas anyone?
make sure you dont have anything important, but i'd rm -rf ~/.gnome* personally
what would that do, and how would i/it recover?
try chown -R user /home/user where user is you username
the only thing i can think of is remove all the gnome settings, rm -rf ~/.gnome* would be the easiest, maybe before doing that create a new user, and see if they have any issues
I can do that, will gnome reset itself afterwards?
gnome will set itself up originally like it was when you first installed ubuntu if you remove the settings
DO i just restart x or reboot?
Here is the error i get http://paste.ubuntulinux.nl/1976
Here is the error i get http://paste.ubuntulinux.nl/1977    sorry Updated
Cheers wil give it a go!
